unnormalised: Flipkart's Big Billion Days sale saw record-breaking transactions this year, with UPI payments surging by 150% compared to last year's event. The average transaction value for purchases made via credit cards stood at ₹7,500, while debit card transactions averaged around ₹3,200. Many shoppers availed of the "Buy Now, Pay Later" (BNPL) option, with total BNPL transactions crossing ₹500 crore during the 7-day sale period.
normalised: Flipkart's Big Billion Days sale saw record breaking transactions this year, with U-P-I payments surging by one hundred and fifty percent compared to last year's event. The average transaction value for purchases made via credit cards stood at rupee seven thousand five hundred, while debit card transactions averaged around rupee three thousand two hundred. Many shoppers availed of the "Buy Now, Pay Later" (B-N-P-L) option, with total B-N-P-L transactions crossing rupee five hundred crore during the seven day sale period.

unnormalised: Paytm reported a significant increase in digital wallet usage, with over 2 million transactions recorded daily. The average amount spent per transaction through Paytm wallet was ₹850. Moreover, the e-commerce giant offered cashback deals worth ₹200 crore to promote digital payments, further incentivizing customers to ditch cash. The sale also witnessed a spike in international transactions, particularly from NRIs purchasing gifts for their families in India, with the total value of these transactions exceeding $5 million.

unnormalised: However, concerns were raised regarding fraudulent activities, with several users reporting unauthorized debits from their accounts. Cybercrime cells across major cities, including Mumbai and Delhi, received over 500 complaints related to online payment fraud during the sale period.
